casebody.data:
BRESOLIN v. RHAY, PENITENTIARY SUPERINTENDENT. No. 4,

Misc.

Decided December 4, 1967. John J. O’Connell, Attorney General of Washington, and Stephen C. Way, Assistant Attorney General, for respondent. Per Curiam.

The motion for leave to proceed in forma pauperis and the petition for a writ of certiorari are granted. The judgment is reversed. Mempa v. Rhay, ante, p. 128.
